residency_requirements: Applicant must accumulate at least three years of residence in Canada during the four years preceding their application.
decision_outcome: Appeal allowed; Zhang's citizenship application refused due to failure to meet residency requirements.
evidence_assessment: Zhang was absent from Canada for significant periods due to her husband's employment in Japan. The citizenship judge improperly considered passive connections and failed to assess relevant facts, such as family ties outside Canada.

decision_reasoning: failure to consider qualitative test of residency
focus on post-application actions without analyzing Canadian ties
application_details: physical and qualitative tests must be applied
evidence_presented: Dedaj was short of physical days but had ties to Canada
result_of_case: case will be reassessed considering both tests
conclusion_outcome: case remanded for reconsideration by another citizenship judge

application_details: Applicant was physically present for only 689 days out of the required 1,095 days due to work outside Canada.
decision_reasoning: residency means physical presence in Canada as per s. 5(1)(c)
cause_of_action: failure to meet the physical presence requirement
procedure_followed: Appeal from Citizenship Court to Federal Court
result_of_case: Appeal dismissed; applicant did not meet residency requirement.

residency_requirements: three years of accumulated residence in Canada within four years preceding the application
immigration_status: denial of citizenship due to insufficient residency

application_details: El Ocla was physically present for 996 days instead of the required 1095 but had established a life in Canada as a tenured professor
decision_reasoning: citizenship judge erred by strictly applying the physical presence test for residency to the exclusion of the qualitative residency test
result_of_case: The appeal was allowed, and El Ocla's case will be reconsidered by a different citizenship judge using the correct legal test
conclusion_outcome: The Federal Court allowed the appeal
